page.title: 02THE RIVER WYE
page.content: The Wye is noted as the best salmon fishing river in England and Wales. Each year the fish return to the river from the sea to spawn in late October to early November. After about 3 months the eggs hatch and the young fish grow for 2 or 3 years before they themselves return to the sea for a year or 2 to grow prior to returning to spawn in the same river in which they were hatched. Other fish of note here are eels which are caught in large numbers lower down the river and the young elvers are netted out as food in the lower half of the river. The Allis shad also enters the river to breed. It is rather a scarce fish in Britain but comes regularly to the Wye reaching as far as Penddol Rocks each May. One other migratory fish to be seen in July in most years is the eel-like sea lamprey.
